title: China eyes space resources, space tourism and on-orbit digital infrastructure
summary:

summary:

title: SpaceX eyes IPO timed to planet alignment and Musk birthday: report
summary:
San Francisco, United States (AFP) Jan 28, 2026


 SpaceX is targeting a mid-June initial public offering that would coincide with a rare planetary alignment and founder Elon Musk's birthday, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday, as the billionaire entrepreneur seeks to raise a record $50 billion. 

The rocket company is planning its IPO for when Jupiter and Venus appear very close together in the sky - a conjunction that occurs for the

title: Earliest launch window to ISS set for February 11: NASA
summary:
Washington, United States (AFP) Jan 28, 2026


 The next NASA crew rotation to the International Space Station could launch as early as the morning of February 11, the US space agency said Wednesday. 

The launch was originally scheduled for February 15 but NASA eyed moving it up after the evacuation of a previous ISS crew. 

The first launch window opens at 6 am Eastern (1100 GMT), NASA said on social media. Additional windows are on the

summary:

title: EU Brings GOVSATCOM Secure Communications Service Online
summary:
The European Union’s GOVSATCOM service was officially brought online on 14 January, offering secure communications to European military and government users. This initial service is enabled by pooling capacity from eight existing satellites in five countries. Initially announced in 2018, the Governmental Satellite Communications (GOVSATCOM) initiative offers sovereign, reliable, secure, and cost-effective governmental satellite communications […]
The post EU Brings GOVSATCOM Secure Communications Service Online appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Crew-12, scheduled to launch on Wednesday 11 February
summary: The crew of four will launch no earlier than Wednesday 11 February at 11:00 GMT/12:00 CET (06:00 EST) from Space Launch Complex 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station, Florida, USA. The next available opportunities are Thursday 12 February at 10:38 GMT/11:38 CET (05:38 EST) and Friday 13 February at 10:15 GMT/11:15 CET (05:15 EST).

title: The West Faces Snow Drought
summary: Very wet—but very warm—weather in the western U.S. has left many mountainous regions looking at substantial snowpack deficits.

title: AI tool mines Hubble archive for hundreds of strange cosmic objects
summary:
Los Angeles CA (SPX) Jan 29, 2026


A team of astronomers has used a new artificial intelligence assisted technique to uncover rare astronomical phenomena in archived data from NASA's Hubble Space Telescope.
